column3: Greetings, honored guessst. How may I be of ssservice?
What kind of place is this?
I am a keeper of tales. Much was lossst in the Flood, and so this duty is more important than ever. How else are the younglings to learn from our mistakesss and build a better world?
Aath must educate the koal, as well as others who have forgotten our hissstory and the wisdom of our forebears.
Long ago we had another home, in the sssouth, until it vanished with the Flood. Those who escaped wandered in sssearch of a new home, until they came to these ruins and claimed them for the Ondo.
The Cupsss, we call them, for the many alcoves into which the wanderers huddled to weather the killing Light. Thus did they sssurvive.
We honor them to this day by pressserving the name and protecting this place. Now and ever after.
Many here may treat you oddly, but it is not out of disssrespect, but unfamiliarity. I pray you do not take offenssse.
That which we lost to the Flood we hope to one day reclaim.

Long did we think this an impossibility, but these are days of change─of ancient sssigns witnessed and prophecies fulfilled. You are an integral part of this, honored guessst. Of change witnessed and change to come...
